column1: back of a length, tucks him up, squeezed out to point via the outside edge. Bit of nibble back into the left-hander
speared down the leg side at 89pmh/143kph, given wide
length in the channel, Finch hammers it through the covers with minimal foot movement, smiting it out the middle of the bat and through the ring. So much power in the shot!
length on the pads, flicked out to midwicket via the front dog and they race back for two, brilliant running
back of a length, skids on, Finch defends back down the track
length in the channel, fenced out to cover and they set off straight away, Klaasen has a shy at the striker's end but his throw flies over on the bounce! Might have been in, regardless
cramped for room, back of a length on the hip, defended awkwardly and it drops at his feet
fullish outside off, looks to go over the top but it's chipped down towards long-off via the toe. Looks to be dribbling away for four, but du Plessis claws it back
slightly full of a length, flicked off the pads down to long leg. 86mph/139kph
offcutter, Finch doesn't pick it looking to make some room, dabs it into his foot and it squirts just past the off stump! Nortje has his head in his hands!
stays legside of it again, Nortje follows him and Finch nudges out to mid-on for a sharp single
back of a length in the channel, stabbed out to deep cover
fullish, angling down leg, looks to whip to the leg side but can't get bat on it

back of a length slower ball, heaved away but straight to the fielder at short midwicket. Miller tries to throw down the stumps at the non-striker's, Pretorius misfields backing up, and they just about make it through for an overthrow with Warner diving at full stretch to make his ground!
legcutter, flicked round the corner past Nortje in the ring
muscled high and mighty over long-on for six! Cross-seam, early transfer of weight as he stays legside of it, clears the front leg and nails it ten rows back!
nudged down the ground, they race through for another sharp single
fullish in the channel, 88mph/141kph, Warner throws his hands through it and slashes it up and over short third man via the outside edge
length ball, bit of movement in, another lightning-fast single
steered behind point, 92mph/148kph
short ball, too straight, Finch pulls off the hip and it runs away very fine for four!
slightly full of a length in at leg stump, inside-edged into the pad and into the covers for a single... 93mph/150kph!
steps outside leg, pushed wide at 93mph/150kph, flashes hard at it outside off stump with an open face and it flies away for four over point!
in the slot on off stump, slower ball this time, but Warner picks it out the hand and bludgeons it over mid-on for a one-bounce four
short and down the leg side, pulled hard through the vacant midwicket region and it rolls away to the rope! Not timed, but enough on it to beat deep backward square running round
flashes at a wide one outside the off stump, Finch opens the face and square drives for four through backward point! Beats the diving backward point, stand-and-deliver stuff
opens up, shimmies to the leg side, and checks an inside-out back-foot cover drive over extra, straight to the fence after a couple of bounces!
yorker on leg stump, dug out straight to wide mid-on but they can still get through for a single
slower ball, back of a length down the leg side
length on leg stump, flicked round the corner via the pad but straight to the man on the 45
full offcutter, hacked out to deep square leg for one
slower ball, back of a length, pulled out to the sweeper on the leg side. 'TWO!' was the early call, but there's never a second run there
length pushed across him at 75mph/121kph, and Warner slugs this into the crowd! Crunched, right out of the screws, and it flies over deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, cut to backward point in the ring
full, down the leg side, called wide
cutter, fullish, clipped out to deep square
slower ball, Warner nearly swings himself off his feet trying to send this into next week but can only swish at thin air!
bottom-edged pull shot, skews away to short fine leg
back of a length, clipped out to short midwicket and they somehow turn this into two! So quick between the wickets
clears the front leg, opens up and hammers this down to wide long-off on the bounce
drag down, Finch's eyes light up and he pulls this round the corner for four more. Drops his length back, real freebie for Finch in this sort of mood
tossed up, yorker, driven back to Shamsi on the bounce
heaved out to deep midwicket for a couple more
flatter, in at the pads, flicked out to deep backward square
clipped down to long-on for a single
full on the pads, worked out to straight midwicket
back of a length, down the leg side. Finch looks to pull and can't get bat on it. Apologetic appeal from Ngidi, who knows it's wide
slower ball in the channel, hacked out to midwicket via the inside half of the bat. They think about two, decide against
full on the pads, clipped down to long leg for a couple
slower ball, wayward and down the leg side
slower ball, outside the leg stump, worked to long-on for an easy single
tailing yorker in at leg stump, worked out to Klaasen grazing at cow corner
dipping slower ball, low full toss on the pads, whipped out to long leg
length outside off, Warner gets down to reverse-slog-sweep very early, but can't get bat on it
tossed up, Warner shimmies down the track and unleashes his power on this, hammering it for a one-bounce four down the ground. Not quite middled, struck low on the bat
shimmies down again, giving himself room to hit to the off side, but can only clip to deep extra cover for one
uses his feet, Shamsi sees him coming, drops it shorter. Worked out to midwicket for one
opens up, looks to go inside-out over the covers, 'CATCH!' is the cry but it won't carry, and the fielder gets round. Brings up the 100 stand in just 8.5 overs
hangs back, punches out to deep cover
length outside off, steered out to sweeper-cover
clipped out to midwicket, they hurry back for two and that brings up Finch's fifty from only 27 balls!
slower ball, Finch opens the face to guide this out to point
slower ball, in the slot, picks it early, and slugs this miles over deep midwicket for a towering six! That's absolutely huge! And brings up Warner's fifty, from 30 balls
clears the front leg and slashes hard out to cover point
dipping slower ball on the stumps, opens the blade and steers out to short cover
flat, on leg stump, clipped out to deep backward square
flat again, on a length outside off, and carved out to sweeper-cover on the back foot
tossed up on off stump, very full, swung out towards midwicket where Rabada makes a diving half-stop... not really a chance, barely a fingertip on it and flew so quickly at him
almost swings himself off his feet trying to slog-sweep, diverts down to short fine leg via the pad
opens up, slashed out to van Biljon at short cover who makes an excellent diving stop
fullish on off stump, carved out to backward point on the bounce where Pretorius fields. Consecutive dot balls!
forced out to short cover on the bounce, they race through for a single
clears the front leg looking to go over the off side, beaten by the offcutter! Nortje shakes his head and mutters a few words in Warner's direction, who grins back at him

gets his man this time! Great catch by Miller running back from short midwicket! Bouncer, pushed across the left-hander, and Warner was late on the pull. Heaved high into the leg side, and Miller gets back to hold onto a difficult chance, falling onto his back as he takes it. Warner departs, SA finally get their breakthrough
length outside off, carved straight to backward point on the back foot. 'Awh, come on!' exclaims Finch
length outside off, no foot movement from Finch as he throws his hands at it and only meets fresh air... 91mph/147kph, Nortje cranking it up!
steps back, pulls a back of a length ball down to backward square from deep in his crease
flat, down the leg side, skews out to square leg via de Kock's gloves. Given as a leg-bye, must have flicked the pad on the way through
length in the channel, not much turn but Wade can only prod back to the bowler
rocks back and carves this out to wide long-off

Finch gets down and across looking to lap this over short fine leg, but Shamsi sees him coming. He's struck on the inner thigh, down on one knee, Shamsi belts out an appeal and it's given! Looked pretty adjacent, and Finch trudges off after an imperious 55. EDIT: Hawk-Eye confirms that would have smacked into the off stump, halfway up.
full and straight, driven out to long-off with soft hands
fullish, brings out the reverse but not a clean connection, and it flicks up to short third man on the bounce
hangs a cutter outside off stump, pushed out to cover in the ring
length, hung outside off, chipped out to the sweeper-cover on the bounce
back of a length, blocked into the covers on the back foot
slower yorker, dug out to deep midwicket and they race back for a couple
back of a length slower ball, swivel-pulled round the corner for six! Picked the length early, just helped it on its way over backward square
another cutter, low full toss, clipped out to long-on to keep the strike
back of a length, outside off, hammered out to deep point with a cut
cutter, forced out to backward square on the pull
shifts across to the off side, slower ball in the channel, Marsh has a slash at it but can't get bat on it
slower ball again, Marsh gets over to the off side looking to hammer this over square leg but can't connect. Very harshly called wide
slower ball again, slashed out to deep point with a cross-batted shot, Marsh grunting as he throws his hands at it

slower ball, very nearly played on, and then not far away from a calamitous run-out! Length on leg stump, looked to slog through midwicket, struck on the back of the bat, it dribbled to de Kock... Wade set off looking for a run, was sent back, and was scrambling back into his crease as QdK tried to kick the stumps down but dragged it wide! Drama!
pace-on this time, length ball, Wade's eyes light up and he nails this over deep midwicket into the stands for six!
back of a length, dragged down the ground to long-on, only one

length ball, pushed across him, skied miles up into the air towards short fine leg... de Kock runs round, gets underneath it, it comes down with snow on it, and de Kock dives forward to take the catch on the edge of the ring! Great grab - early call to clear the area, and then kept his eyes on it all the way down
short ball, pulled elegantly in front of square for four! Full extension of the arms, and out the middle
slower ball, guided to short point on the back foot

given lbw! And reviewed almost immediately. Low full toss, looked like it might have been sliding down the leg slide on first viewing. Struck on the shin, no bat involved. Aaaaand....missing leg stump according to ball-tracking!
length in the channel, driven to long-off to keep the strike
hangs a slower ball outside off, Marsh gets across to the off side looking to mow this over midwicket, but only connects with thin air! Harshly given as a wide
and another one given wide! Hung outside off, pace-off again, looked to play through cover off the back foot but couldn't connect.
holds in the pitch, length in the channel as Marsh looks to slug over cow corner, and is beaten
crunched down to wide long-off, only a single
slower ball on fifth stump, whipped to deep midwicket with quick wrists, Miller fields well to prevent a second
slower ball, yet again, sliced very high in the air down towards short third man, and Shamsi takes the catch! Nearly swung himself off his feet, through the shot too quickly, and Shamsi holds on!
punched out to deep extra cover on the back foot, Klaasen gets round brilliantly, diving to his left to cut it off. Great running though, as Carey dives to make his ground for the third
slower ball, punched out to deep point on the back foot
driven with a straight bat through the covers for a couple
full, in at the pads, whipped out to short midwicket
slower ball, hung full outside the off stump, Smith doesn't pick it shaping to drive and is beaten
shuffles across to the off side, slower ball, clipped to fine leg in the circle for one after waiting an eternity for the ball to arrive... very slow slower ball!
full on off stump, pushed across the left-handed Carey and whipped down the ground to long-on
length outside off, Smith flays his bat at it looking to cut but only finds van Biljon at point on the bounce

bowled 'im! 79mph/127kph, full and straight... hang on a minute, has he overstepped? Yes he has! Nightmare for Rabada, timber went flying as Smith got across to the off side and couldn't get bat on a slower yorker which burst through his legs!
nails his yorker, Smith chips it into the off side looking to go down the ground, and it lands in no-man's-land
clipped out to deep backward square

low full toss, short-arm jabbed out to midwicket, Nortje is running in off the fence but shells the chance! Never looked comfortable under the high ball, similar chance to the one Lockie Ferguson took in the World Cup final - difficult, but gettable
timber this time! Offcutter on a length, Carey clears the front leg, is through the shot early, and it pings back the top of middle! No overstep this time, much to Rabada's relief
pulled out towards midwicket, only a single
slower ball outside off, Smith clears the front leg and plays a tennis-style forehead down the ground, out to long-off
full outside off, something of a half-volley, full extension of the arms... high in the air, but over du Plessis at long-on and into the crowd!

slower ball, flies miles up into the air but into no-man's-land... there's a man diving underneath it, but he can't hold on! Looks like it was Klaasen running in from deep midwicket, burst through his hands as he dived forwards
shifts across to scoop, doesn't get all of it, and fine leg catches up with it
full extension of the arms, inside-out over extra cover for six! Extraordinary batting, high front elbow, zero foot movement other than to rock onto the back foot, and timed into the stands!
slower yorker on the stumps, clipped out to midwicket for a couple
slower ball on a length outside off, pulled hard to deep midwicket and they race back for a second
flogged into the covers, an ambitious start and a fine interception at full stretch from Matthew Wade
dabbed to the off side, and picked up at cover once more
very full length, tailing in, and what a sumptuous strike! Perfectly vertical bat, oozing with timing, and patted through a very straight mid-on

ping! That's perfection from Starc, an identikit dismissal to de Kock's Joburg castling, aiming to clip to leg, but beaten by late outswing, and the top of middle stump takes a pounding! He ends up staring forlornly towards midwicket, and well, is that the game there and then?
swinging past the leg stump this time, but must have flicked pad along the way as there's no wide called
banged in short, that's a fizzing lifter, and it raps the gloves hard! Well, that's a lively first over!
wheeling away with an angle in towards the stumps, flicked off the legs behind square
opens the face for a back-foot steer to point
slower ball, back of a length, nurdled off the toes to square leg
back of a length, stabbed to short cover, good sharp running as they seek to get back up with the rate
slower ball again, back of a length, languidly driven to cover, with exploratory intent
width, wafted to deep point for the single. Tidy over from Cummins, keeping it to a run a ball will do nicely for Australia
zips over the top of middle as van der Dussen pulls at thin air
a wide, wild outswinger, wide outside the tramlines
clouted back through the line! Broad-shouldered biffage from Rassie, picking the cross-seamer and flinging his arms into a lofted drive
width, and clattered up and over the covers! Freeing the arms, with glee! That's more like it for South Africa!
yorker, tailing in, but well watched from Rassie, sensing the likelihood of a danger ball and tapping it for the single to cover

reaching for the slash over third man, and Zampa clings onto a blinder! Another huge breakthrough, full length, wide line, Faf was nowhere near the ball but had a go anyway, his spiralling outside edge almost had enough toe-end on it to reach the rope, but Zampa somehow located the ball in the wind, and clung on with both hands, flinging himself backwards
lifting down the leg side, Carey can't gather cleanly
zipping past the outside edge on a tighter line, well bowled, and well beaten. Australia look in the mood to dominate
shaping into the right-hander, just back of a length, stabbed down through third man off the back foot
back of a length again, tight line outside off, and dribbles to the keeper on the second bounce. Cunning change of pace
quicker delivery on a full length, poked to cover on the front foot

flogged into the building site! Wow, that was just a fraction short, Klaasen was loitering on the back foot like a mugger in the shadows, and utterly slotted his pull through the line over wide long-on!
chopped down into the off side, hopping onto the back foot for the point sweeper to gather
through to the keeper outside off to complete the over. Are South Africa waving or drowning? They are still making a splash in between whiles ...
up on the toes, punched off the back foot down through backward point
whittled off the legs to backward square
back of a length, fourth-stump line, flashed to backward point with an outside-edgy stab
bashed hard back down the pitch, Cummins stoops in his followthrough and gets a hand on the ball as he does so
slower ball, full length, well picked but slapped straight into the covers
back off a length once more, pressed into the covers with a flourish in the followthrough
nurdled off the pads to midwicket, another single
cracked hard to cover
too short, too wide, placed with timing past the point sweeper!
cracked in front of point this time, and the sweeper has an easier time intercepting this one. Taking the pace off once again, outside off stump
cutter, on a back of a length, straightened after pitching as Klaasen sized up the flick to leg. Good running as midwicket runs in to gather
crashed to cover, up comes the fifty, and there goes the Powerplay too
back of a length, flashed back down the pitch, eludes Agar in his followthrough
on the pads, worked to deep midwicket
round the wicket, straightening into the pads, worked to square leg
a shimmy to leg, but Agar sticks to his guns with an off-stump line, pumped out to deep cover
stabbed to short third man, the rate continues to creep up
excellent stretching stop from Richardson. Klaasen was down on one knee for the sweep, under-edged it with pace through backward square, but a one-handed stretch cut off a probable boundary
flogged out to deep cover
back of a length, hauled to the on-side with a cross-batted swipe

reverse-hoick, and back goes the middle stump! Well, something had to give, Klaasen climbed into a pre-meditated switch-hit, and did everything right except connect with the ball! Too early through the swing, and Zampa pulls out a chainsaw-esque celebration that looked uncannily like something Dale Steyn might come up with...
patted to the leg side
wafted out to point, lovely elusive flight allied to a tight line
can't nudge this one off the pads, and Forecaster slumps to 7.2%
out comes the ramp, no pace to work with, but played with impressive perpendicularity, clean over the keeper's head
quicker ball, outside off, fenced off the legs to backward square

another ramp, and a brilliant catch from Zampa! He saw the angles early, sprinting from short third man the moment that Rassie shaped for the shot, and flung himself full-stretch to scoop it off the turf! This could get messy ...
whittled to wide mid-on, flicking from outside off
full face of the bat, patted to short cover
flicked into space on the leg side once more, just the five runs and a wicket in another constrictive over
advancing out of the crease, rapped on the shin by a well-flighted googly, but struck outside leg
compact sweep, out to deep square, and good running to get back for the second
dipping into the toes, flicked with intent to square leg. Singles ain't going to cut it, but I think South Africa know that...
back of a length, another googly, fenced to cover off the back foot
well bowled, skidding on, but sliding down the leg side as van Biljon is rapped on the shin

through him like a dose of the pox! Tossed up on off stump, skids straight on as van Biljon turns his wrists into a clip to leg, but can only grimace as the ball crashes through the gate and into the timbers!
tapped into the gap
leaning back for a slap to deep cover
nurdled off the legs, more singles to the cause
straightens from back of a length, connects well on a flat swat across the line but straight to midwicket
tucked firmly off the legs, but that's just another single
whipped on the up to mid-on, Agar is rattling through his night's work with barely a shot in anger against his wiles
a shimmy to the pitch, tucked to midwicket

a dirty great wipe across the line, so nearly bowled, so nearly stumped! Pretorius uses the momentum of his violent followthrough to propel him with a complete lack of dignity, safely back into the crease. Eww...
nudged to the leg side
reverse sweep, that's actually very well played, but a fine tumbling stop at what was point and is now backward square
poked out to cover point
clipped from a leg-stump line, on the up out to midwicket. Zampa's spell is zapping all resistance
a battered pull out to deep midwicket. A slight fumble on the boundary's edge lets them get back for two
rocking back for a cut into the covers
a monstrous pick-up over midwicket! The perfect length to treat with utter contempt, hoisting high with a skiddy seam, clean into the stands!
banged in short, Pretorius pokes at it with a vertical bat, like a slightly off-balanced gun on a partridge shoot. And misses
slower ball, off line, maybe South Africa can do it in extras?
cracked out to the off side

slower ball, slapped straight to cover. That will be that then! That all happened in slo-mo, a yawning, telegraphed drive, reaching for the wide ball, finding no timing, and skidding a low chance to the edge of the ring. It's not Miller time no more...
back of a length, slower ball, cautiously pointed towards point

slower ball, a massive yahoo across the line! And up goes the finger! A slight suspicion of under-edge as Pretorius reviews ... but err ... no. He's seen the initial replay, and knows it's curtains! Thumping off stump and South Africa slide deeper into the soup
worked to the on side, nothing doing there
slower ball, back of a length, flapped to deep cover
opens the face, nurdled to third man. A direct hit would have been out!
stand-and-deliver. A flat-footed swipe to a lifting ball outside off, finds thin air
slower ball, tight to off stump, worked with stiff wrists to midwicket
pressed out to point
reverse-sweep, and that's plumb too! Nortje gets in a tangle to a regulation length ball, and Agar's evening just gets better. This is turning into the most one-sided 2-1 series loss of all time...
bowled him! Agar is on a hat-trick once again, with No. 11 in his sights! A revolting hack towards some distant point in the Antarctic, the ball scuds on with the arm, into the timbers... crumbs!
cripes, that's close! A quicker ball, zeroing in on the top of off, and fenced away with a frantic inside-edge!
swished to point off the back foot
on the toes, clipped hard to the leg side, to ironic cheers
fired into the legs, and pops behind square for another single
whoops, that's a freebie to any quality of batsman, a half-volley on the toes, and chipped sweetly through fine leg
full length, dipping into the pads, a massive appeal, and up goes the finger! It's all over! Faint hints of an inside-edge, but South Africa have no reviews, and they've been thumped by 97 runs ...
